title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2408.11 - Procedures on denial of initial registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2408.11 - Procedures on denial of initial registration

State Regulations
(a) Decisions to deny registration of a
proposed curriculum may be appealed in accordance with the following
procedures: (1)

Within 15 days of receiving
notice of the decision to deny registration of a proposed curriculum, the
institution shall notify the president in writing of its intention to
appeal. (2)

Within 90 days of
receiving notice of the decision to deny registration of a proposed curriculum, the institution shall submit its appeal to the president. The appeal shall take
the form of a written statement which presents the institution's position and
all evidence and information which the institution believes is pertinent to the
case. The appeal shall include a statement and explanation of the specific
grounds of the appeal. (3)

Within
60 days of receiving the institution's statement of appeal, the president shall
issue a determination on the appeal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2408.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
